page.title: 11EDUCATION
page.content: Rainhall Road School was built in 1862 so it is a very old school but now it looks like brand new.We have had suspended ceilings and redecoration. All our wooden furniture has been cleaned up and now it looks like brand new.There are five classrooms, a hall two cloakrooms,and infant, boys and girls toilets.There are 87 children in the school and 3.8 teachers divided into four classes.Mr. Heath the Headteacher,teaches class4,the oldest children who are 10 and 11 years old Mrs. Wilkinson teaches class3 Mrs.Barr(.8)class2 and Mrs.Mills the Deputy Head teaches class1 who are the youngest children in the school.Also there is a voluntary playgroup with about 20 children run by Mrs.Kendal and Mrs.Crawley.About 35% 0f our children have their origins in Pakistan.
